sn35.242:3.1: 242 The Simile of the Tree Trunk (2)
sn35.242:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimibilā on the bank of the Ganges river.
sn35.242:4.2: Seeing a large tree trunk being carried along by the current,
sn35.242:4.4: “Mendicants, do you see that large tree trunk being carried along by the current of the Ganges river?”
sn35.242:4.6: When this was said, Venerable Kimbila said to the Buddha:
sn35.242:4.7: “But sir, what’s the near shore and what’s the far shore? What’s sinking in the middle? What’s getting stranded on high ground? What’s getting taken by humans or inhumans? What’s getting caught up in a whirlpool? And what’s rotting away?” …
sn35.242:4.9: It’s when a mendicant has committed the kind of corrupt offence from which there is no rehabilitation.
